ACT
138
The statute of limitations for the right to demand inheritance
The right to demand inheritance as an heir of the decedent against an honest possessor who also claims that he is entitled to it as an heir expires one year after the heir learned of his right and of the possessor of the inheritance, and no later than ten years, counting for the legal heir from the death of the testator, and for the testamentary heir from the promulgation of the will.
According to the dishonest possessor, this right expires in twenty years.
